p: Machado et al. [ 192] investigated the effects of E. oleracea on rat models with endometriosis. After the treatment, they observed a significant decrease of the endometriotic lesions surface. Furthermore, E. oleracea demonstrated its anti-inflammatory properties, by decreasing the levels of VEGF, PGE2, MMP-9, and COX-2. Through the activation of caspase-3, E. oleracea induced apoptosis and decreased cellular proliferation [ 193].
